fields.description:
h3. Summary
If you add the value _[CHART] Date of First Response_ in the Board Settings > Card Layout, the board will break and won't load.

h3. Environment
- Kanban board
- Scrum board

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# go to board settings > card layout
# add the value _[CHART] Date of First Response_
# go back to the board

h3. Expected Results
The board will open 

h3. Actual Results
The board won't load and a blank screen is shown, with no errors

h3. Notes


h3. Workaround
Remove this field from the board settings
fields.summary: Board not loading and no error is shown

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Jira and Bitbucket integration won't update commit URL's after renaming the Team username in Bitbucket

h3. Environment
- Devevlopment panel
- Jira Cloud and Bitbucket Cloud integration

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Integrate Jira and Bitbucket with a *Team account* via DVCS and then edit the Team account name:

# associated JIra - Bitbucket with a team account
# committed with regular name and ID, it worked
# changed Team account ID (which by default, is the same as the name)
#* The links to the commits, etc, changed
#* Links in Jira to commits in Bitbucket stopped working (saying that 'that links has no power here'), the links should have the new team ID instead
#* Jira stopped syncing new commits (they are not getting to Jira anymore to be shown in tickets)
# deleted and recreated the integration and the old links remained with the old links (broken links) while new links showed with new team IDs (and work)

h3. Expected Results
Links of commits in Jira issues development panel should update to reflect the new Team name.

h3. Actual Results
Links of commits in Jira issues development panel show old and broken link to an old Team name.

h3. Workaround
fields.summary: Jira and Bitbucket integration won't update commit URL's after renaming the Team username in Bitbucket

fields.description:
When you create a new Status you need to define its Category (To Do, In Progress & Done)
 When you move a Issue from a Status which is in Category Done to a Status in either Category To Do or In Progress the resolution shall be removed. Why is there no easy way to do this?

In my World why set a status in a category and then not use it smart!

Suggestion: Make it easy to enable a feature to remove set resolutions when move to a Status which shall not have a resolution.

As you explain: [The anatomy of a Jira Software workflow|http://view.mailer.atlassian.com/?qs=fbc32c295781541bfe1cf31c048c5c711cacee98015c219f3532d6f98587072f1f86baee65dc2495b3adba4f4e036aaeddba66f39bb15ca5bc705ae4f671159b9f08d841340d075d1d6027de56d9eb1e736dfa3d7ea3349a]

_Setting resolutions incorrectly You must set a resolution when an issue moves from an unresolved state to a resolved state. Likewise, resolution needs to be removed if an issue flows back into an unresolved state._
fields.summary: Clear Resolutions when moving to a Status defined as Todo/InProgress

fields.description:
As can be seen in attached screenshot, I happen to work on a project where the 'Resolution' field for issues is mandatory. (and even if I ignore the asterisk, it's one of the first fields one hits when reporting and issue).

I find this field needs better documentation: As a reporter one asks, "do you mean I already Fixed the issue?" "do you mean I want the issue to be Fixed? (instead of aiming for a "WontFix" resolution)" "Why is 'open' not the default? Is 'open' even in the list?"

The tool tip next to the dropdown box doesn't help because it explains that issues can be resolved and what the various resolutions are (waiting for confirmation, wait for release, fixed, can't reproduce, …) none of which strikes as applicable during creation.

 

PS: does this field actually do anything? I created an issue as 'Fixed' but its created state is 'Unresolved'
fields.summary: Provide (better) tool tip for field 'Resolution' in issue creation

fields.description:
h3. Summary
As for now, when you delete an issue directly from a kanban board, Jira redirects you to /issues/ page. Deleting Issue from Kanban board should redirect the user back to the Kanban board instead, the same way Jira behaves when deleting an issue from a Sprint board.

h3. Environment
* Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Kanban board
# Delete an issue on the board

h3. Expected Results
Issue is deleted and the user is sent back to the Kanban board

h3. Actual Results
Issue is deleted and the user is sent back to /issues/ page
 
h3. Notes

h3.Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: Deleting Issue from Kanban board should redirect the user back to the Kanban board

fields.description:
h3. Summary

While using the backlog view, right-clicking on an issue the last couple of options are off the upper of the page.

h3. Environment

Backlog view.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Go to a board backlog view;
# Right-click on an issue;

h3. Expected results

The menu appears on the clicked issue.

h3. Actual result

The menu appears in the upper of the page.

h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Itens missing from the right click on backlog view

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If you use a quick filter (filtering by assignee) in a kanban board, transition an issue, then deactivate the filter, the column names won't follow when you scroll down.
See  [^Column name won't follow.mp4] 

h3. Environment
Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In a kanban board, filter the issues displayed by assignee;
 # Perform a transition with an issue (drag and drop in another column);
 # Deactivate the filter;
 # Scroll down the page, you will notice that the column names will be static and won't follow.

h3. Expected Results
The columns' names should follow as you scroll down the page.

h3. Actual Results
The columns' names remain static.

h3. Workaround

No workaround at the moment
fields.summary: Kanban board's column name will stop being displayed

fields.description:
h2.Summary

Currently the Manage Sprint permission for projects are not working as users are able to see the complete sprint button on all sprints.

h2.Steps to Replicate

# Clear of all groups/users/role  from the Manage Sprint permission.
# Check sprints. 

h2.Expected Result

Without Manage Sprint permission, you should not see the complete sprint button on sprint.


h2.Current Result

Irregardless of the permission, the complete sprint button shows on sprints.

h2.Workaround

Update an issue (for example, transition an issue from one column and then back again) in the affected sprint, then refresh the page.
fields.summary: 'Manage Sprint' permission not working. Complete sprint showing for all users

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Issue details view _header_ of old Jira issue view bugs when clicking _comment_ button from the Active Sprints board.

h3. Environment
* Jira software cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a scrum project on Jira Software
# Configure Story Points to show in Issue View
# Disable New Jira issue view lab from the user profile
# Create a Sprint with a text in the goal field and start it.
# On the Active Sprints boards, click on an issue.
# On the detailed issue view, scroll up until the *Comment* almost touches the end of the browsers screens
# Click on *Comment*

h3. Expected Results
Open comment box.

h3. Actual Results
Comment box pushes the issue details _header_ behind in the board header frame, making it inaccessible.
 
h3. Notes
Tested on FullHD and 1366X786 resolutions.

h3.Workaround
Opening another issue and then reopening the last one reloads the header.
fields.summary: Issue details view header of old Jira issue view inaccessible behind board header

fields.description:
We  have version 6.4.12 and want to upgrade to the latest 7 version,  tried to upgrade yesterday and we were unable to do it, the page was down so we went back to the old version. I would like to know what is the best way to upgrade our current software to the latest one. We currently purchased the new license SEN-11531968.

 

Thank you
fields.summary: Version Upgrade

fields.description:
Currently, the story points are counted for all issue types(except subtasks).
It will be great if the user could select certain issue types to include in the count, since we sometimes create Tasks from Stories, and want to count the story points only for Stories while viewing them in a single backlog.
fields.summary: Allow selecting the issue type to count for Story Points

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The summary view of a Software project is accessible via URL, but not via the project sidebar.

h3. How to reproduce
# Create a Software project.
# Navigate to https://domain.atlassian.net/projects/pkey/summary.
#* You will have access to the project's summary page.
# Check the project sidebar.
#* The summary button is not available there.

Example: https://jira.atlassian.com/projects/CONFCLOUD/summary

h3. Suggested Resolution
Add the summary button at the project sidebar.
Update the documentation [Viewing a project|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracorecloud/viewing-a-project-765593099.html.]
fields.summary: The summary view of a Software project is accessible via URL, but not via the project sidebar.

fields.description:
Hi!

We have installed the add on bigpicture and it has appear the next bug.

Could you help us?

 

Thank you

 

!image-2018-03-21-16-46-59-885.png!
fields.summary: bug in BigPicture

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When switching from tabs like *Active Sprint* or reloading the *Backlog* view the texts for the quick filters overlap in the old UI.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Reload *Backlog* view
or
 # Switch between *Backlog* view tab to *Active Sprints* view

 !Agile_Board_-_Jira.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes

This only happens in the old UI (ADG2) and frequency varies depending on network speed and browser.
h3. Workaround

Refresh the page or switch to New JIRA Experience
fields.summary: Filter texts overlapping in Backlog view

fields.description:
When clicking on an issue from our sprint I can quickly view it. 

I just now noticed that when I opened a story in a new window that there's is more and also important text that I can view here and was not visible in the other view.

I think it has to do with the fact that the story that was mentioned is done.
However for us, since we were referencing to the story coz the way the work has to be performed, this is crucial. And now could go unnoticed when one only uses the 'click-on-story-from-the-active-sprint-to-view'.

 

Hope this is clear enough, could not add screen shots.
fields.summary: Not all of the desk is displayed when in quick mode.

fields.description:
Problem
JIRA admins can make changes in projects, issues, user management. However, the audit log can't show who is this Admin.

Suggestion
The username who made each change is shown in the Audit Log, even if he/she is a JIRA admin.
fields.summary: I want to find, in the audit log, JIRA admins who have made changes.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Ordering by Votes does not work on a Software Kanban Board

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new project with a Software Kanban board
# Go to board settings. Change the filter from 'Project = [ProjectName] ORDER BY RANK' to 'Project = [ProjectName] ORDER BY Votes DESC'. This will turn off 'Ranking' on the Kanban board.
# Make sure that the 'Backlog' is the first column on the Kanban board and not the separate backlog view.
# Create at least two new stories
# The stories will be ordered by date created or something. Remember the order before voting.
# Ask some colleagues to vote for both stories but make sure one story has more votes than the other. Make sure the story appearing lowest on the Kanban board gets more votes
# Refresh the kanban board.

h3. Expected Results
Stories being sorted by votes.

h3. Actual Results
No change. Vote ordering not working.
 
h3. Notes

h3.Workaround
* Make the 'Backlog' the separate kanban backlog, so not on the Kanban board itself.
* The Backlog list view adheres to vote ordering
fields.summary: Ordering by Votes does not work on a Software Kanban Board

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Jira randomly rank issues if user adds them to the Sprint in bulk

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Have a Scrum board with 10 issues or more
#* !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
# Create a Sprint
# Click on "footer line" to include multiple issues in the Sprint
#* In some cases, the Rank will be randomly changed after they are included in Sprint
# Select all the issues > move back to Backlog
# Refresh the page
# If it doesn't randomly changed, keep repeating the above steps and refresh the page.
#*  [^Jira Rank.webm] 

h3. Expected Result

Rank doesn't get changed.

h3. Actual Result

Rank is changed randomly for those issues.
fields.summary: Jira randomly rank issues if user adds them to the Sprint in bulk

fields.description:
Column Constraint in kanban and scrum board can now exclude subtasks.

I wish that it also could exclude epics and sprint goals.

The best solution might be if one could do a filter to exclude whatever one wants from the count. (similar to a quick filter)
fields.summary: Exclude epics and sprint goals from Column Constraint

fields.description:
The problem with the boards in work mode (i.e., Active sprint page) is that only 3 issue cards are displayed at a time on the screen in a given column, compared to the backlog giving almost 20 with lot more details. Due to the nature of the projects and the shared resources between them, users often have to adjust ranking of issues across projects in an active sprint as things change. Only seeing 3 at a time is too limiting in this regard.

Extreme issue view on the dashboard gadgets helps for some extent, but ranking can't be done on dashboards.

Need the Active Sprints view to be made as comprehensive as the Backlog view with the Status visibility easy to see so that teams do not have switch between pages.
fields.summary: Cannot use Agile Boards or Dashboards for project management

fields.description: We would like to be able to define different roles in a tempo account so that when we log hours into issues that are linked to those accounts, we can choose a role and Jira will pull the hourly rate for that role from the table where it was defined in the tempo accounts page.
fields.summary: Define roles and hourly rates for specific tempo accounts

fields.description: I dont want to use Beta Version and can'd disable
fields.summary: Need to have ability to disable Beta version

fields.description:
Good afternoon guys, how are you?

I need to insert a comment into a task in my Jira Cloud, but it informs a limit of the characters in the text.

I had to increase this limit, how should I proceed?

Thank you!
fields.summary: Increase the amount of characters in the task comment

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Refreshing the browser with a marked quick filter doesn't update the Assignee filter result after unselecting that quick filter.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a label or other field to use as a quick filter variable. For example: create the label *Triforce*
 # Set this label to some issues and let issues from a specific assignee without this label (i.e. let issues assigned to *Ganondorf* without this label).
 # Select the *Triforce* label in the *Quick filter* drop-down menu.
 # Refresh the web page.
 # Unmark the *Triforce* quick filter.
 # Use the *Assignee* drop-down menu and search for *Ganondorf*.

{panel:bgColor=#f8f8f8}
(!) Check this [GIF|http://recordit.co/CH993rwTBj] with the execution of those steps.
{panel}
h3. Expected Results

Since we've unmarked the quick filter, we should be able to search for issues assigned by a user where that label is not used.
h3. Actual Results

When we search for that user the result is: *No matches*.
h3. Solution / Workaround

Refresh the page after unselect the quick filter.
fields.summary: Jira don't get the correct 'Assignee' list after refreshing the page with a marked quick filter.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Statement
Work Completed on the Burnup Chart issue breakdown is summing up wrongly if the sprint has work scope decreased

h3. Steps to replicate
# Create Scrum Board and an issue with Zero Story points (optional)
# Create a new Sprint with the issue and Start
# Create new issue with Estimation of 2 Story Points on the Backlog
# Add the issue into an Active sprint
# Decrease the story point from 2 to 1 Story points
# Transition the Issue to Done
# Complete the Sprint

h3. Expected Result
The Work Completed in Sprint breakdown on the bottom of the burnup chart should show the transition from *0 -> 1* Story Points 

h3. Actual Result
Number of Work Completed is transitioning from *0 > -1* instead (work completed is being negative)
 !Screen Shot 2018-03-14 at 11.30.48 AM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
No workaround for completed Sprint
Or Prevent from Work Scope being reduced
fields.summary: Incorrect Completed Work for Burnup Chart when Work Scope decreases

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In Agility boards, when a username has been changed, is not possible to assign issues to this user. It Throws the following errors:

*Something's gone wrong*
 *An error occurred on our end.* *Refresh the page and try again.*  

and

*User 'username' does not exist*

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an Agility board
 # Create some issues and assign them to a specific user
 # Sort the issues: group by *assignee*
 # Update the username for this specific user
 # Click on "+" for create an issue on the board 

!Screen Shot 2018-03-13 at 5.55.27 PM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Expected Results

It creates an issue and automatically assigned this to the user
h3. Actual Results

The errors below occur:

!Screen Shot 2018-03-13 at 5.40.58 PM.png|thumbnail!

!Screen Shot 2018-03-13 at 5.40.41 PM.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes

Apparently, Jira attempts to search for a user with a specific user key in cwd_user via username. However, this will only work if the user key and the username match will not be the case for users that were renamed.
h3. Workaround

The current workaround is set the username used originally when the user was created.
fields.summary: Not able to assign issues for an user with the username changed in Agility board
Sprint Lanes broken by filter

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Kanban boards are presenting a Plan Sprint message in their backlog.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a kanban board.
# Enable the backlog functionality.
# Access the kanban backlog having no issues assigned to the status next to the backlog status. 

h3. Expected Results

No message should be displayed.

h3. Actual Results
The following is displayed:
 !kback.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Kanban boards are presenting a Sprint warning at the backlog

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

* Project permissions currently take precedence over Scrum/Kanban board(JQL filter) permissions
* A JQL filter is used to display issues on Scrum/Kanban boards
* Boards that are attached to projects are not accessible to those who do not have the appropriate permissions to view that project.  For Example:
-* User 1 has access to both "Scrum" and "Project X" projects
-* User 2 doesn't have access to the "Scrum" project
-* User 2 has access to the "Project X" project
-* The board filter displays issues from the "Project X" and "Scrum" projects
-* User 2 needs to be able to access the "Scrum" board

||Board settings||
|!board_settings.png|thumbnail!|

||Boards user 1 has access to||Boards user 2 has access to||
| !user_1.png|thumbnail!  |  !user_2.png|thumbnail! |

||Boards user 2 has access to after "Scrum" board location has been changed to a user||
| !user_2_after location change.png|thumbnail! |

h3. Suggested Solution
* Allow board(JQL filter) permissions to take precedence over project permissions
* Project permissions should still apply, i.e. if a user doesn't have permission to view issues in a particular project, then issues from that particular project should still be hidden

h3. Why this is important
* In cases where the board filter displays issues from multiple projects, there is a requirement for a user to view a board that's attached to a project, but not have permissions on the project
* Having to change the location of the board can confuse users on the project as it will seem like the board had disappeared from the project

h3. Workaround 
* Change the location of the board from a project to a Jira user - {{board settings(...) > General > Location}} .  The board will no longer appear on the project but will be accessible by anyone with the appropriate board(JQL filter) permissions
fields.summary: Allow board(JQL filter) permissions to take precedence over project permissions

fields.description: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/creating-a-board-764477949.html]
fields.summary: Broken include on Creating a board docs page

fields.description:
In the Create Issue and Edit Issue screens, the "Sprint" menu should list sprint names in the "Suggestions" that are disambiguated by board. 
This already happens in the lower "All sprints" section of the menu, but not in the upper "Suggestions" section.

Without this disambiguation it is easy for users to select an identically-named sprint (e.g. "Sprint 3") from the wrong board.

This would be nice because "Sprint 1", "Sprint 2", etc, are the JIRA default names for sprints, so it is common for the boards of multiple projects to have identically named sprints and thus be completely ambiguous in the Sprint menu.

This could be a good format: PROJECT NAME - Sprint [1,2,3]
fields.summary: Sprint name should be disambiguous when creating or editing issues

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Project administrators can add status for Software Simplified Workflows on board column configuration but are unable to delete the status.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

- Create a new Kanban project. Software simplified workflow will be used. 
- Grant user the Project Administrator permission to the project.
- Set the user as the Administrator of the Board.
- As the user granted with administrator access, go to the Board column configuration.
- Add a status. 
- Delete the same status.

h3. Expected Results

Project administrator should be able to delete the software simplified workflow status from the board. 

h3. Actual Results

Project administrator is unable to delete the status.

 !delete.png|thumbnail! 

Error Message : You must be a project administrator of project '<Project>' to remove a status


h3.Workaround

Request the JIRA administrator to delete the status.
fields.summary: Project administrator cannot delete status from the board

fields.description:
h3. Problem

In the new Jira experience, the left navigation menu does not show the boards option. However, in the old Jira, the boards option appears to be at the top navigation menu. 

 

Suggestion

To have Boards option in the left navigation menu in the new Jira experience
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Missing Boards option in the left navigation Side bar in new Jira experience

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The time tracking information for a Sprint in the Backlog view is to close to the Backlog section, giving it the impression that this data is connected to the issues in the Backlog when in reality there for the issues in the Sprint.
 !_JST-373890__vertical_spacing_is_weird_-_Atlassian_Support_System.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested solution

There should be more vertical spacing so the separation can be easily distinguishable.


||Original request||
|See screenshot. The part that says "1 issue Remaining 5h Estimate 4h" appears to be connected to the backlog part but it is in fact about the sprint (Milestone 60) above. Please add more vertical spacing between this element and the Create Sprint button.|
fields.summary: Sprint time tracking information to close to Backlog

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when deleting a future sprint (planned sprint), all the issues will be sent to the next future sprint, with no dialog or confirmation.
 [^deletefuturesprint.mov] 

h3. Suggested Solutions
Add a dialog to let the user chose where to send the issues: next future sprint or backlog.
fields.summary: Let the user decide where to send the issues when deleting a future sprint

fields.description:
Currently for JIRA to execute actions from smart commits on a specific issue, the smart commit needs to have the exact casing as the JIRA issue ID (TEST-1). 

It will be more flexible if there is an option that also allow for case insensitive processing.
fields.summary: Allow option to enable case insensitive issue IDs for smart commits

fields.description: NVDA and JAWS do not read to User indication that Login Has Failed. User is left in the username field without any indication of why? Please acknowledge the Login Failure to blind users.
fields.summary: Failed Login is not verbalized to blind users

fields.description:
h3. Summary

All the JIRA Software reports like Burndown Chart and Sprint Report are missing the right-side scrollbar which makes the navigation difficult for some users.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a software project
# Access the reports page
# Open the Burndown Chart report

h3. Expected Results

There should be a scroll bar on the right-side of the page to help in the navigation. 

h3. Actual Results

There's no scrollbar:
 !scroll.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes

Reproducible in the last version of Chrome and Firefox.
fields.summary: JIRA software reports are missing the right-side scroll bar

fields.description:
As a scrum team member, I want the Agile Sprint Health Gadget on dashboard to reflect, not only the stories / main tasks, but also the subs (optional setting)

Details:
So, the new nice Agile Sprint Health Gadget does not count sub-tasks. 

Since we are completing a lot of our total stories in the end of a sprint, this is a problem, the gadget does not reflect the actual progress in terms of total issues. 

Eg. 8 stories are in a sprint, they have 5 sub-tasks each, the gadget only shows the 8, not the total 40, or 48 if you would count the Stories.
fields.summary: Agile Sprint Health Gadget not counting sub-tasks

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Burnup chart shows incorrect "scope projection" if its issues have more than one sprint

h3. Environment
Jira Software Clud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a sprint with an issue (add estimation on it)
# Complete the sprint
# Move the issue to another sprint and start it
# Open the *Burnup Chart* for the new sprint
#* There will be wrong values one you hover *scope projection*

h3. Expected Results
The "scope projection" follows the date sequence according to the sprint start and end dates.

h3. Actual Results
The report shows wrong dates. e.g.: Last year dates
 
h3. Notes
* 

h3.Workaround
*
fields.summary: Burnup chart shows incorrect "scope projection" if its issues have more than one sprint

fields.description:
h3. Summary

On a setup where the board's swimlane is based on *Stories*, using the assignee filter may break the *Issue Detail View*. 


h3. Steps to Reproduce

- Configured the board to have swimlanes based on *Stories*
- Assign a Story to *UserA*
- Create a sub-task for that Story and assign it to UserB
- Set the Assignee filter to *UserB*.
- Try to open the issue detail view of the Story by clicking on the issuekey.

 !Story.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

The board should show the Issue Detail View of the Story or at least notify the user that the Story is only visible as a swimlane category and is not assigned to the filtered assignee. 

h3. Actual Results

Issuekey for the Story is clickable and no issue detail view will be opened
fields.summary: Assignee filter on a board with stories swimlane may break the issue detail view

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Filter Queries break Board's Location

h3. Environment
 
* JIRA v1001.0.0-SNAPSHOT

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On a clean instance, create 5 separate scrum projects
# Edit the filter query for the board associated with one of the projects
# Change query to something like 'project = "project 1" or project not in ("project 5")'
# Save changes to the filter

h3. Expected Results

Board is still associated with the project specified in the location field of the board's settings

h3. Actual Results

Board is no longer associated with the project specified in the location field of board's settings

h3. Notes

This seems to affect some complex JQL. If you change the filter query to 'assignee = user' it'll cause the same issue

h3.Workaround
Rewrite filter query used by Board
fields.summary: Filter Queries break Board's Location

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When loading a JIRA Software board (such as a scrum board) with a machine that does not have a dedicated Graphics chip, or does not have graphics acceleration built into the CPU (like modern Intel Graphics), the load times will become approximately 3 - 4 times longer.

h3. Environment
Cloud wIth Older hardware which does not have a Graphics card or graphics accelaration using the CPU that still runs Google Chrome/Firefox, or VM with Graphics acceleration disabled.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
- Using a Virtual box VM, install any version of linux. Ensure that graphics acceleration is disabled. You can also use a server or any hardware without graphics acceleration that runs VGA.
- Using firefox or chrome, compare the performance to that on the vm with acceleration.



h3. Expected Results
performance would be proportional to the power of the CPU.

h3. Actual Results
Performance is about 4 times worse implying a reliance on hardware graphics acceleration.
 
h3. Notes
N/a

h3.Workaround
Install a graphics card if possible.
fields.summary: Boards in JIRA Load very slowly if Hardware Graphics Acceleration is not available.

fields.description:
h2. Summary

When configuring columns in the board settings, there is no (?) help that leads you to a documentation on how to do this or the importance of the "colours" when mapping the statuses.

This leaves users unaware of these factors and ultimately, incorrectly, setting up their boards.

h2. Suggested solution

Ideally, there should be a (?) leading users to the [Configuring columns|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/configuring-columns-764477997.html] documentation and more emphasis on the importance of the colours representation.

||*Original request*||
|The “Configuring a Board” page mentions nothing about the importance of column positions or colours in relation to issues being completed. It just talks about customizing colours as if it is purely aesthetic. The JIRA UI makes no indication either. Even if this is working as you expect, I would consider it a documentation or usability bug|
fields.summary: No mentions about the importance of column positions or colours

fields.description:
You should add the name of the Board the Sprint is in. 

Its in the view of creating a new issue. 

 

I would have liked to upload a image to show what i mean but it says: 

JIRA could not attach the file as there was a missing token. Please try attaching the file again.
fields.summary: Add the Board of  the sprint

fields.description:
Problem Definition

Currently, the autocomplete feature present in browsers is enabled for the quick filters select list. This ends up forcing the customer to click two times to select a quick filter, one for the dropdown with autocomplete options to disappear and another to select the quick filter.

Suggested Solution

Set the autocomplete property for the quick filters select list form or add the ability for the customer to toggle this behavior on or off.

Workaround

It should be possible to workaround this by creating a tempermonkey script that sets the autocomplete property on the quick filters form to off upon loading the respective site page.
fields.summary: Disable autocomplete for quick filters select list
As a Jira Software user, I want to be able to see the cycle time of each issue in a cluster on Control Chart report

fields.description:
We have two projects sharing the same Field Configuration one does not require an "Epic Name" to be listed when creating a clone of a Jira Service desk in it's project ([https://travellink-technology.atlassian.net/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=37&projectKey=DC|https://travellink-technology.atlassian.net/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=37&projectKey=DC)]) the other project ([https://travellink-technology.atlassian.net/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=2&projectKey=TT|https://travellink-technology.atlassian.net/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=2&projectKey=TT)]) does require it.

We would either like both to be optional or when creating the clone from within Service Desk, to be able to choose the Epic. At the moment no Epic field is visible in the story creation screen.
fields.summary: Cannot make field optional

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Jira Software Projects can be linked to a Confluence Space so that Users can easily link to Project Notes stored in Confluence (like Meeting Notes, Retrospectives, Requirements, etc) however customers would like a way to Hide the Pages section altogether

h3. Suggested Solution
Include an option to Hide the Pages section in a Jira Software Project so that it's only visible to Project Admins until linked to a Confluence Space and implement an option that only allows a Project Admin the ability to Set or Change the Linked Confluence Space

h3. Why this is important
Customers would like the ability to control who has permissions to change the linked Confluence Space and/or limit who can view the Pages section altogether within Jira.

If a Space is not linked, a message appears to link the Project to Confluence:
!NotLinked.png|thumbnail! 

Users who do not have permissions to the Linked Space receive a message stating that they do not have permissions to view, however they could change the Linked Space to something else:
!NoPermissions-ChangeSpace.png|thumbnail! 

Additionally, if the user does not have access to Confluence, the Pages section is still visible, but if they try to access, got the following error:
!NoPermissions-Confluence.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround 
None
fields.summary: Limit Who Can View Linked Pages and Change the Linked Space

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Backlog is empty if the board has only one column

h3. Environment
Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a board
# Add an issue to backlog
# Delete all columns from board and keep just one
# Map all statuses to the column

h3. Expected Results
Issues are listed on backlog

h3. Actual Results
No issue is listed on backlog, only on the sprint if it's active
 
h3. Notes


h3.Workaround
Create another column
fields.summary: Backlog is empty if the board has only one column

fields.description:
In Jira a new option just popped up "pages". Where you can link spaces or create pages directly. Great idea. Not so great implementation. 

I linked to a space, this was a bad idea......as I cannot remove the space. 

1) I want to be able to remove the link to the space. At this time all I can do is to link to a different space. I.e. I can not remove the space. Fix please. 

2) I want to be able to link to a Confluence page not only a space.
fields.summary: Jira link to Spaces could use some love

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The project Agility is a great idea for uncomplicated "create and go" work. However, eventually, the requisites of the project would change and admins would need to modify a workflow, for example. In this situation, admins will find themselves unable to configure the project as needed.

h3. Suggested Solution
Explain the main limitations of the Agility project on the creation process. Examples would be the inability to change the project's workflow or add a second board to the project.

h3. Why this is important
Enhance the user and admin experience. Should avoid the extra hassle of creating a new scrum or kanban project and bulk move all the Agility issues to the new project.

h3. Workaround 
If modifications are needed, a new scrum or kanban project should be created and issues should be bulk moved.
fields.summary: Better explain the project Agility limitations on creation
bud
Need admin access for the Agency Directory Program for Taylen Peterson

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The table head is in the wrong place - as you can see in the below screenshot.
 !Screenshot.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
You have to open the Kanban board, scroll down a bit, and go to another tab and do something else. After some time, if you go back to the original tab and scroll, the header is "locked". It doesn't always happen, and I haven't noticed how long you have to wait.

Occurs in Linux and macOS X.

h3. Workaround
Refresh the page
fields.summary: Table Header in the Wrong Place

fields.description:
Following error came up this morning on {{/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=38&projectKey=OCTPLA}}
Screenshot coming.
URL: https://comcard.atlassian.net/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=38&projectKey=OCTPLA

Reporting this on behalf of a friend who works for this customer. Feel free to reach out to the customer if needed.
fields.summary: TenantContextException

fields.description: I need to verify the date started is different than the current date in a logging work screen, I tried with the date compare validator and the field has been modified validator and in the combo box does not appear this field.
fields.summary: It is not possible to validate de date started in a transition

fields.description:
At the moment I have access to 2 Jira Cloud accounts and I expect this number to grow in the future. However when I want to switch between the accounts first I'm presented with an "access denied" screen. From here I can log out and then log in again with the corresponding user.

One possible solution would be an implementation of an account selector similar what Google did. Upon logging on a pop up appears an asks the user to choose between their accounts. A more robust solution would be to be able to link accounts under a single login. This way the user could be able to use all sites with a single login while privileges could be associated to the account corresponding to the given site.
fields.summary: As a Jira user I want to be able to use multiple accounts without a logout/login session to facilitate using more than one Jira instances
Notify the repositories to be add on DVCS account list when not automatically synchronizing all of them.

fields.description:
Visual example 

!kanban-board-split-columns-example-chart.png|thumbnail! 
Image source: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/vsts/work/kanban/split-columns
fields.summary: As a Jira Software user, I want different statuses mapped to a column being displayed as sub columns

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, there does not seem to be anything that limits which Sprint an issue can be added into when done via the Issue View Screen (with the 'Sprint' field). This can cause confusion as it could show Sprints from boards from a different project or cause users to link the issue to the wrong Sprint due to Sprints having the same name.

h3. Suggested Solution
Have a feature where JIRA will warn users that the issue(s) is being added into a Sprint that was created in a Board from different a project - validate this with the Board JQL too.

h3. Workaround
Since Sprint names are not unique in JIRA, try using unique Sprint names with a prefix of the Project so that it will be easier to distinguish them.
fields.summary: Ability to restrict the sprints shown in the 'Sprint Field'

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Smart commits are not working on Github integration on pull requests.
The commits are shown on the Development Panel however if a comment is added to the commit message, this comment is not added to the issue. Also, the transitions are not being performed.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud integrated with Github

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Perform a pull request with a message. e.g.: KEY-1 # comment test
OR
* Perform a pull request with a message. e.g.: KEY-1 #done test

h3. Expected Results
Commands added to the pull request message are performed

h3. Actual Results
The pull request is listed on Development Panel but the commands on commit message fail
 
h3. Notes
* 

h3.Workaround
*
fields.summary: Smart commits are not working on Github integration on pull requests

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Warning related to misconfiguration is shown for custom fields used by Agility projects

h3. Environment
* Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an Agility Project
# Open the custom fields page and search for Epic Link or Epic Name

h3. Expected Results
The Agility screen is not listed and no message is shown.

h3. Actual Results
On UI:
{noformat}
This field is misconfigured and is associated with screens that are not displayed here. To fix this, please contact support.
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes

h3.Workaround
fields.summary: Warning related to misconfiguration is shown for custom fields used by Agility projects

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The Kanban board board can't be scroll down smoothly using Chrome browser in Mac OS, when there are 3000+ issues in the board.
h3. Environment

OS: Mac
 Browser: Chrome Version 63.0.3239.132 (Official Build) (64-bit)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open the Kanban Board of a project
 # Make sure to have a list of 3000+ issues to scroll down (it works fine with 300 issues)
 # Start scrolling down through the Kanban board

h3. Expected Results

To be able to scroll down the board smoothly.
h3. Actual Results

The scrolling functionality does not work smooth and fluently.
h3. Workaround

Since this issue is only reproducible in Chrome browser in Mac OS, when there're 3000+ issues in the board. The recommended workarounds could be either of followings:
 * Break down the board issues into boards with smaller amount of issues
 * Use Mozilla Firefox browser
 * Use Windows/Linux
fields.summary: Unable to scroll down the Kanban board smoothly in Chrome

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

On the new JIRA experience, there is the *Assignee* quick filter on the Agile boards. This allows the users to filter the issues by choosing the assignee on the drop down list. At the moment, when you refresh the board or revisit the board, the chosen assignee's from the drop down will not be re-used.

 !assignee quick filter.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow the *Assignee* quick filter history to be re-used when revisiting or refreshing the board. This already is possible for standard board quick filters.

h3. Why this is important

There are cases where there are multiple assignees on the board. It takes a lot of click to re-apply the Assignee quick filter when refreshing or revisiting the board.
 
h3. Workaround 

- If there are set assignees that needs to be filtered constantly, create a quick filter via the board settings for each of these assignees (Three Dot Menu -> Board Settings -> Quick Filters). The board will then set up standard quick filters and those can be re-used when refreshing or revisiting the board.
fields.summary: Allow chosen assignee quick filter to be reused when revisiting the board.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
After migration from Cloud to Cloud, DCVS configuration is still in place when you check it and development panels are still showing the old entries. However, upcoming push from Github are not received since the Webhook is not configured.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Setup Github with DVCS connector in instance A
# You can check in webhook settings in Github that there are 2 webhooks set for instance A
# Migrate data to instance B
# No new webhook setup is created in Github

h3. Expected Results
* New webhook setup for instance B should be created in Github

h3. Actual Results
* No new webhook setup is created in Github

h3.Workaround
* In the DVCS connection page of instance B, delete the Github account and recreate it as per this documentation:
** https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/connect-jira-cloud-to-github-814188429.html
fields.summary: DVCS Webhook on Github side not updated after Cloud to Cloud migration

fields.description: There could have a condition option that checks if the issue has sub-tasks. This way it would be possible to control weather a issue has sub-tasks or not and allow it's transition.
fields.summary: Add condition in the workflow based on sub-task existence

fields.description:
As a user of Jira Software

I want to be able to display a column in the backlog with a picto that indicates if the issue is blocked by another unfinished issue

In order not to deal with blocked issues
fields.summary: Dynamic column showing the blocked status of an issue in the backlog

fields.description:
As a JIRA and Bitbucket user, I would like the branches section of JIRA's issue screen to display the latest build status for each branch, so that our QA team can be sure they're testing the latest passing version of the code.

There seems to be ample space in this screen to display a build status icon – it could be the same as displayed in Bitbucket – in this popup.  Somewhere between Pull Request and Action would work.

!Screen Shot 2018-02-14 at 12.17.41.png!
fields.summary: Display build status of Bitbucket branches in JIRA issue

fields.description: In the old UI we were able to get to a sprint board with a single click on the boards dropdown and the selecting the board. This was available from any place in the interface. I have a general issue with the new UI where everything is hidden multiple page loads deep, which feels really slow to switch between my most used pages. It would be great to be able to "favorite" or "pin" filter, boards, etc to the top level nav
fields.summary: As a Jira Software user, I want to quickly access my "favorite" boards and filters from the top level of the nav

Issue detail view (sidebar) cannot be fully scrolled down if the project doesn't include sub-tasks

h3. Actual Results

It can be reproduced if user has full name that contains next characters: "šić"
fields.summary: Can't decode jwt in add-on

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Allow Jira Software Cloud to show target start/end date of Portfolio for Jira 

h3. Problem Definition
In Cloud environments, only two custom fields of Portfolio for Jira(Team and Parent Link) can be searched in Jira Software.

h3. Suggested Solution
Jira Software Cloud can search for target dates and specific plans for Portfolio for Jira Cloud.

h3. Notes
In Server products, user can search for more fields.
* [Searching for issues using Portfolio details|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfolioserver/searching-for-issues-using-portfolio-issue-details-940678957.html]
fields.summary: Allow Jira Software Cloud to show target start/end date of Portfolio for Jira

Start sprint doesn't handle the Finnish date format, after picking a date from calendar the text input is in Finnish, and that doesn't pass the validator.

After changing the date, expand the month name to the full name.

 

!image-2018-02-02-13-33-33-728.png!

Agility boards don't display default JIRA fields like priority.

Add an option to edit the card fields or add the default fields back in.

Currently a user have to click Assignee quick filter then select the desired assignee.

h3. Suggested Solutions

 !image-2018-02-01-18-34-35-201.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Ability to use Assignee quick filter side by side instead of drop down

fields.description:
Could you please allow users to change the order of their favourites dashboards in the new UI?

It is currently not possible. A *drag and drop* option would be great.

 
h4. Workaround:

If you have the dashboards A, B, C and D.
 Favourite them in this order, D, A, C, B, they will be listed in this same order:
 Dashboard
 D
 A
 C
 B
fields.summary: Ability to change the order of favorites dashboards in the new UI

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Issues cannot be moved to backlog on Backlog view of Kanban board if the status mapped to backlog has id 0 on workflow.
However, if you open the issue and use the workflow buttons then the transition works.

h3. Environment
* Jira Software Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Import a Trello board on a Jira instance
# Export the workflow created as XML
#* There will be a step with id 0
# Create a Kanban board for the imported project
# Map the status related to step 0 to the column Backlog
# Create an issue and move to status mapped to the first column of the board
# Go to Backlog view and try moving the issue to Backlog list
 
h3. Expected Results
Issue is moved to Backlog

h3. Actual Results
{noformat}
Something isn't letting us move XX-XXX to Backlog. Ask your project administrator to check the workflow settings and transition conditions.
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
(Optional - If Necessary)

h3.Workaround
- On workflow, remove the status related to the step with id 0
- Add the status back and recreate the post-functions/validators/properties/conditions
fields.summary: Issues cannot be moved to backlog on Backlog view of Kanban board

fields.description:
We would like to able to configure the starting view when you choose to see another software project.

Currently, when you go to a software project you are always directed straight to the board view. We would like to have the ability to configure to view "releases" as standard starting view.
fields.summary: When navigating through softwares projects, ability to configure the starting view "releases" instead of board

fields.description:
Assuming it's another Compass issue; Please fix:
 [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/configuring-the-issue-detail-view-764478043.html]

 

Report from the public: [https://twitter.com/darthted/status/958901001146195969]
{quote}Excuse me @Atlassian but all the examples on how to configure the new issue view window fail to render in the docs - [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/configuring-the-issue-detail-view-764478043.html]
{quote}
fields.summary: broken includes on issue detail view page

fields.description:
User case:

You have two boards, A and B.

The board A have the status Done and Closed under the last column, the board B have the status Closed under the last column and the status Done under a yellow column (in progress column).

If you complete the sprint via board A, all issues associated to both status will be completed, however, at same time, the issues associated to the status Done on board B will be moved back to the backlog.

User request:

The complete sprint action should be applied to all boards according to the board settings where it was run.

Alternatively, the definition of “done” should be consistent with the workflow definitions.
fields.summary: The complete sprint action should be applied to all boards according to the board settings where it was run.

fields.description:
When creating a project from a shared configuration (existing scrum project with agile board) in  the new Jira experience; the create board icon to create a board for the new project is no longer present.  If i switch over to the old experience then i have that create board button available. 

 Can we add this back to the project level to make it easier for admins and project admins to create boards?
fields.summary: Missing Creating Board icon when creating from Shared Configuration

fields.description:
Right now, the system fields Epic name and Sprints are hidden if they have no value.

Other system fields such as FixVersion and Labels are always shown even with they have no value.

It would be great to let the customer choose whenever show or not the system fields Epic name and Sprints.

There is an existing feature request for custom fields, however, I'm not sure if it would apply for the system fields: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-2997
fields.summary: Option to show or hide empty Epic name and Sprints fields at the issue view screen.

fields.description:
The knowledge provided in this KB won't work: [How to Automatically Set Issue Security Level for Sub Task During Creation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-automatically-set-issue-security-level-for-sub-task-during-creation-824349620.html].

It is expected that you can't set a issue security level to a sub-task. Sub-tasks will only inherit security levels from their parent tasks.

There are suggestions for allowing that: [JRASERVER-5869|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-5869], [JRACLOUD-5869|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-5869].
Notice that they have been set as won't fix.

So an add-on should not be able to bypass that condition from Jira.
fields.summary: The following KB should be removed

fields.description: Unlike the Issue Type Screen Schemes and other lists, the Screens and Screen Schemes are not sorted aphabetically. This makes it hard to search and maintain.
fields.summary: Sorting order of screens & schemes

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, users are unable to add the "Parent Link" field from JIRA Portfolio the Board Issue Detail View

h3. Suggested Solution
Enable users to configure this field to show up in the Issue Detail View.
fields.summary: Make the Portfolio "Parent Link" field available on the Board Issue Detail View

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, there is no way to expand or collapse all Future sprints in *Backlog* view

h3. Suggested Solution
Have a feature to expand or collapse all Future sprints in *Backlog* view. Similar feature that is available for * swimlanes Active Sprints* view.
fields.summary: Expand/Collapse All sprints in Backlog

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When viewing an issue that belongs to a future sprint, clicking on *View on Board* on the *Agile* panel will redirect the user to the board. If the future sprint is collapsed, JIRA will not automatically expand the future sprint. Which makes it hard for users to find which sprint does the issue belongs to.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have an issue that belongs to a future sprint
# Go to the issue
# On the *Agile* panel, click on *View on board* on the right
# JIRA will then redirect the user to the relevant board.
#* If the issue is in a future sprint, and the sprint is not expanded, it'll not automatically expand and show the issues
#* If the issue is in backlog, it'll show as backlog can't be collapsed

h3. Expected Results
* The collapsed sprint should be automatically be expanded, and highlight the issue belonging to the sprint

h3. Actual Results
* The sprint remain collapsed, however, the issue is still being highlighted but not visible as it is hidden from the collapsed sprint, and the *Issue detail view* is shown on the right.
fields.summary: View On Board doesn't automatically expand the future sprints in Backlog view

fields.description:
Summary
 git branches are being incorrectly translated to "remo" (oar) instead of "ramo"(branch)

 

Environment

On Issue Details View, while using the Italian translation for Jira

!Screen Shot 2018-01-29 at 15.34.51.png|thumbnail!  

Expected Results

"branch" should either be left untranslated or should be correctly translated to "ramo"

 

Actual Results

Wrong translation, "remo"
fields.summary: Wrong translation for "branch" to Italian

fields.description:
Field name: Epic Colour
Field description: Epic Color field for JIRA Software use only.

!16608.png!

Both "Color" (American spelling) and "Colour" (British spelling) on same screen.
fields.summary: The same field is spelled in two ways, "Epic color" (American spelling) and "Epic colour" (British spelling).

fields.description:
h3, Summary

Epic and Version panel progress bar is not updated in Kanban board for any estimated work done.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a new Scrum project type (it will create Scrum board automatically)
# Create a new issue (ie. Story), a version and an Epic in it.
# Drag and drop the Story to the above version and Epic
# Change the estimation unit to Original Estimate and enable tracking Time Tracking
# Open Backlog and put some hours for Original Estimate to the Story.
# Create a new *Kanban board* based on above project
# Enable Backlog and Epic panel
# Transition the Story to Done

h3. Actual Result

# The progress bar in Scrum board is updated. (/)
#* !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
# The Progress bar in Kanban board stay at 0% (x)
#* !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Result

The Progress bar in Kanban board is updated, just like Scrum board.
fields.summary: Epic and Version panel progress bar is not updated in Kanban board

fields.description:
I am planning to purchase Jira Software for own purposes. Always was used Jira where pannel / bar was on TOP the same as you have it here:

!image-2018-01-29-14-43-47-759.png!

But in my version I have left bar panel and it's difficult to adopt to that.

!image-2018-01-29-14-46-34-119.png!

How can I change it to have UI the same as it was on screen above?
fields.summary: Bar panel

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Swimlane toggle is missing in board and there is no way to open the swimlane one by one.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Open Kanban/Active Sprint view
# Notice that the Swimlane toggle is missing which makes impossible to expand/collapse issues in the board. 

h3. Actual Result

Swimlane toggle is not shown. 
!swim.png|thumbnail!  
!swim2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Result

Swimlane toggle is shown.

h3. Workaround

- Use the keyboard shortcut *"-"* (dash) to open all Swimlane. Or
- Use Jira old UI (only available for some instances)
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Swimlane toggle is missing in board

fields.description:
Jira Cloud mobile app does not show the backlog for projects with Kanplan enabled.

Please enhance functionality of Jira Cloud app.
fields.summary: Kanplan - Enable Backlog on JIRA Cloud Mobile App ( IOS )

fields.description:
Jira 7.1 introduced the requirement that the Jira server should be able to perform requests against itself on its base URL, i.e. the same URL that the user's browser uses to access Jira.

This behaviour has previously been filed as a bug in JRASERVER-59892 (resolved as "Not a bug") and the setup needed to allow Jira server loopback calls has been documented in [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-fix-gadget-titles-showing-as-__msg_gadget-813697086.html] (linked to from JRASERVER-59892)

Our use case makes it impossible to implement the advice given in the above support page, and this issue contains a description of a workaround we have implemented as well as a suggested improvement to Jira allowing customers sharing our problem an easier way to configure their server.

*Use case*

Our Jira instance is available on two different domains: Users on the company internal network use [https://jira.company.net|https://jira.company.net/], whereas external users use [https://jira.f5.company.net|https://jira.f5.company.net/] (imaginary domains used to examplify). The latter is a reverse proxy with an additional layer of two factor authentication, required by our corporate security policy for access from external networks.

When a user accesses a Jira dashboard through [https://jira.f5.company.net|https://jira.f5.company.net/] the Jira server attempts to do a number of GET /rest/gadget requests against the same base URL. Obviously these fail since the Jira server does not have the required reverse proxy session established. The result is that the user experiences the problems described in the above mentioned issue and support page.

*Our workaround*

We have worked around this issue by making the Jira server call itself directly instead of through the reverse proxy. This was achieved by defining jira.f5.company.net as 127.0.0.1 in /etc/hosts on the Jira server and by adding the jira.f5.company.net SSL certificate to the server.

Although things work as desired with this setup we consider it an ugly hack (especially since we have to copy a fairly sensitive SSL certificate to a server to which it doesn't really belong) and we would very much like to see Atlassian provide a configuration option allowing us to achieve the desired behaviour in a less hackish manner.

*Suggested improvement*

We propose that you add a new configuration parameter to Jira containing the base URL that should be used for internal lookups. Using this parameter we can direct the Jira server to itself by using Jira configuration rather than hacking /etc/hosts. The parameter should by default not be set, and in this case Jira should exhibit its current behaviour.
fields.summary: Allow admins to specify the base URL to be used for Jira server connections to itself
